data.title: Elections: Hong Kong Legislative Council 2004 General
data.text:
At stake in this election:

60 seats in the Legislative Council (LEGCO)

Description of government structure:

Chief of State: President of China HU Jintao *

Head of Government: Chief Executive TUNG Chee-hwa

Assembly: Hong Kong has a unicameral Legislative Council (LEGCO) with 60 seats.

* The President of China is elected by indirect vote by an 800-member election committee to serve a 5-year term.

Description of electoral system:

The President of China is elected by indirect vote to serve a 5-year term.

In the Legislative Council (LEGCO), 30 members are elected by indirect vote to serve 4-year terms and 30 members are elected by direct popular vote to serve 4-year terms.***

*** 30 members are elected by indirect vote by functional constituencies and 30 members are elected by direct popular vote, all to serve 4-year terms.

Main parties in the electoral race:

Party: Democratic Party (DP)

Leader: Martin LEE Chu-ming

Party: Democratic Alliance for the Betterment of Hong Kong (DAB)

Leader: Jasper TSANG Yok-sing

Party: Hong Kong Progressive Alliance (HKPA)

Leader: Ambrose LAU Hon-chuen

Party: The Frontier (TF)

Leader: Emily LAU Wai-hang

Party: Liberal Party (LP)

Leader: James TIEN

Last Legislative election:

Last Election to the Legislative Council: 10 September 2000

Population and number of registered voters:

Population: 6,783,500 (2004)

Registered Voters: 3,055,378 (2000)

Gender Data:

· Female Population: 3,528,865 (2004)

· Is Hong Kong a signatory to CEDAW: N/A

· Has Hong Kong ratified CEDAW: N/A

· Gender Quota: No

· Female candidates in this election: Yes

· Number of Female Parliamentarians: 12 (following the 2004 elections)

· Human Development Index Position: 12 (2014)

· Social Institutions and Gender Index (SIGI) Categorization: N/A

Disability Data:

· Is Hong Kong a signatory to CRPD: N/A

· Has Hong Kong ratified CRPD: N/A

· Population with a disability: 1,017,525 (est.)
